jobTitle: Line Coordinator $24-$34/hr + shift differential based on experience and certifications
jobDescription: General information All posting locations Coshocton, Ohio, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 29-Jul-2022 Ref # R-55159 Description & Requirements Hours of work would be as appropriate to cover normal Line running hours. Must be able to perform duties of general maintenance in a way that is consistent with plant policy and standards. The employee must have the following qualifications Ability to communicate and work with others Reliability Ability to work safely Ability to work full-time and overtime Basic Mechanical experience necessary On the job training available Knowledge of industrial- mechanical and electrical maintenance A Line Coordinator needs to possess knowledge in areas of equipment capabilities- safety- product specifications- team building- team leading- and certified in all line jobs. The Line Coordinator specific duties may include- but not be limited to- the following Owns setting adjustments for assigned equipment. Coordinate which raw materials to run based on production needs. Perform equipment maintenance as specified in the manufacturer’s manual and/or certification programs. Adjustments to equipment- product or supplies through the natural process variation to promote maximum efficiency. Plan and coordinate maintenance activities with production. Prioritize preventative maintenance schedules. Must be able to efficiently use SAP- including writing and closing work orders. Must be able to follow all explicit instructions and seek help when needed. Perform all necessary pre-operation safety inspections as specified in the operator’s manual and/or certification programs Responsible for the proper operation of equipment in compliance with the GMP’s to ensure proper cleanliness of product. Must possess a Positive Attitude / Outlook and develop effective and cooperative relationships with all operation support departments Safety must possess an excellent safety record- and exhibit safe actions and behaviors in all job duties. Your past safety record will be taken into consideration. Aiding Supervision and other Line Employees in the training and scheduling of employees to the line. Being thoroughly versed on all matters pertaining to Safety in the Job- Department and Plant. Ability to perform calculations of process measurement to include but not be limited to yield- utilization- or nonconformity rates. Communication to all appropriate personnel regarding tasks that needs to be accomplished in order to maximize efficiency. Filling in for Line members for unplanned relief or to help troubleshoot a problem. Use good maintenance practices to achieve the highest possible quality and yield results. Know and follow Operations Quality Product Specifications in performance of job. Responsible for complying with the accident prevention and compliance programs. Comply with all proper and taught procedures regarding chemical uses per Safety Data Sheet instructions. Responsible for setup/teardown for all lines. Perform additional duties as directed by supervision. The Line Coordinator will not discipline nor directly cause discipline to be given to any other Union employee while performing normal duties as Line Coordinator. The Line Coordinator will be forced over if the line is forced over. All Line Coordinators will be required to stay until the tasks are completed in the case of a line being forced over. The Line Coordinator will be required to stay even if their designated line is relieved early. The Line Coordinator will work shutdown. Must be able to work full-time and overtime. jobTitle: Line Lead - Starting at $21.04/hr - Retention bonus $2-500 (3rd shift 5:30pm-6am)
jobDescription: General information All posting locations Holland, Michigan, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 19-Sep-2022 Ref # R-60890 Description & Requirements The Kraft Heinz Company is currently seeking for production line lead candidates to work at our sauces- and pickles processing facility in Holland- MI. This position requires individuals to perform general production duties in a food manufacturing environment following strict quality and safety standards. Minimum Qualifications 2 years of leadership experience Ability to lift 50 pounds Ability to stand for 8-12 hours Capable of working 8-12 hours Candidates must be available to work all shifts including second- third & weekends Prior manufacturing experience is preferred EEO Policy Kraft Heinz is an EO employer – Minorities/Women/Vets/Disabled and other protected categories Benefits & Compensation Overview Medical- Dental- Vision Additional perks Pet Insurance- (EAP) Employee Assistance Program- Company paid Life Insurance- Company paid Short-term disability Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) or Health Savings Account (HAS) with Company contribution Wellness Program Starting Pay Rate $21.04 an hour Rate after certification of 2 lines $22.35 Rate after certification of 4 lines $23.09 Shift Premiums Second shift an additional $1.00 Third shift an additional $2.00 New Hire Bonus Program $700 – After 3 months $800 – After 6 months $1000 – After 1 year For a total of $2500 from your start date! Work Schedule Monday-Friday- including some weekends 5 30am-6 00pm and 5 30pm-6 00am Plant & Community Overview Plant Overview Approximately 300 employees 1st- 2nd and 3rd shift opportunities- assigned based on business needs and seniority Union Plant- represented by UFCW Local 705 Products Vinegar- BBQ Sauces- Relish- Pickles- Mustard The Holland plant is one of the oldest plants in the company and has been operating since 1897. Although- locally known as the “pickle factory”- currently pickles only make up 5% of the total production. In 2016 the factory installed grey poupon mills to allow the production of its iconic mustard. Community Overview Welcome to Holland https //www.holland.org/ “From the award-winning downtown to the white sandy beaches- you'll fall in love with Holland's small-town charm and big-city amenities. Dine along the waterfront or at a local café. Hike to the top of a sand dune or climb to the top of a windmill! Shop for a paddleboard- or a pair of wooden shoes. We recommend you attend our world-famous Tulip Time Festival- visit one of our neighborhood art fairs- enjoy a theatre performance- stroll the downtown sidewalks- or tour a modern college campus. Sail the waters of Lake Michigan or hike the trails in one of our wooded parks. Watch a brilliant sunset over Lake Michigan. No matter what your interests- you won't be disappointed!” (Source www.holland.org ) Job Overview A successful candidate in this role is a fast learner- likes to observe and recommend changes to improve their jobs. Feels comfortable working with mechanical equipment. Candidates in this role will have plenty of opportunities to work overtime- and opportunities to be trained on different jobs and earn higher wages. This is an ideal job for somebody looking for long term career with a stable- reputable company. Responsibilities & Duties At the end of production- make sure everything is shut down and perform the required paperwork. Enter the HACCP results in the computer at the beginning of the shift. Set the cap code and case code by entering the appropriate information into the computer. Prepare line for production at the beginning of shift or when switching to different products. Obtain all necessary paperwork and information for each production day. Must learn the safe and proper operation of the packaging filling equipment. Perform set-up- start-up and changeover procedures for the equipment as needed. Responsible for clean-up of the equipment after smash-ups or misfeeds. Responsible for monitoring and communicating any process or product abnormalities to your Supervisor- Team Leader- or Line Technician. Performing Good Sanitation Practices (GSP’s) when handling equipment. Must follow Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP’s). Perform all required observations and training timely and as scheduled. Perform all other duties as assigned by the Supervisor or Team Leader. General information All posting locations Muscatine, Iowa, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 03-Nov-2022 Ref # R-62819 Description & Requirements Key Responsibilities of the Role Directs maintenance personnel to ensure that all systems operate at their highest capability to meet required production schedules- quality- costs and schedule priorities Improves reliability- maintenance and processing methods to reduce cost and avoid loss of production as a result of equipment malfunction or failure time. Determines equipment capabilities- safety and operational condition in coordination with the other Supervisors and technicians. Develops preventative maintenance procedures that are cost effective and increase the operational life of the equipment. Seek and implement the continuous improvement of the process through equipment improvement modifications. Assist in the development of the system and operational standards and corrective actions. Develops- implements and reviews regularly- site-specific maintenance logs for department. Coordinates- arranges- and supervises- or provides for the completion of corrective and preventive maintenance in accordance with company operating procedures- practices and financial considerations. Provide maintenance training to include the effective utilization of the maintenance logs- completion of routine maintenance specific to facility- equipment operations and support. Assists workers in diagnosing malfunctions in machinery and equipment. Studies production schedules and estimates worker hour requirements for completion of job assignment. Assist with preparing requisitions to determine the number of spare parts to be kept in inventory. Assist in maintaining departmental operating budget at a positive variance by effectively utilizing the workforce and equipment. Assist with safety training- monthly safety meetings- member of safety committee- and provides technical support for all safety projects- and supports implementation of the 9-key element process. Evaluates long-term needs in relation to major projects and factory improvements. Ensures that equipment and facility are maintained in a safe- operable condition and/or arrange for replacement/upgrades. Establishes procedures and contacts to ensure timely repairs of equipment. Directs workers in electrical- electronic- mechanical- hydraulic- and pneumatic- and utility systems maintenance and repair of machinery and equipment. Directs workers engaged in dismantling- assembling- and installing industrial machinery. Assists with developing department employee relations by continued communication of all information affecting them and through the conduct of monthly departmental safety meetings. This is further enhanced by employee and personal participation in the Plant Safety and Ergonomics committees. Analyzes production downtime reports- determines opportunities- and initiates action plan to increase efficiencies. Participate in the QRMP yearly audit and assist in the development of procedures and corrective actions. Oversee and lead the implementation of the QRMP (Quality Risk Management Process) system and operational standards as outlined in the plant accountability list in order to achieve targeted RCR. Assist and partner with business leaders on implementation of process improvement (Six Sigma / Lean/ Kraft Heinz Management System (KHMS)) including leading change initiatives- planning- and facilitation. Assist with the supervision of Maintenance staff including but not limited to performance management and employee development- etc. Communicate with outside agencies i.e. contractors- equipment suppliers- technical consultants and vendors. This person must have a good understanding of the Total Quality Management concept and how to utilize TQ tools in problem solving and continuous improvement initiatives. The specialist must be knowledgeable of all processing- filling- and packaging equipment- hand and shop tools- as well as pneumatic and hydraulic systems. Responsibilities & Duties Troubleshoots and maintains safe and efficient operation of all plant processing- filling and packaging equipment. Provides training to the Line Techs in the operation- troubleshooting- and maintenance of all plant processing- filling and packaging equipment. Ensures proper materials are used during repair and construction to minimize corrosion. Plant & Community Overview Plant Overview 206 employees Non Union Plant Plant History J.L. Kraft purchased the Phenix Cheese Company in 1928- only 25 years after selling cheese to grocers in Chicago from his horse drawn wagon. In 1929- approximately 90 employees in the Kraft-Phenix Cheese Plant in Beaver Dam produced 10 million pounds of Philadelphia Cream Cheese- Neufchatel- Camambert Cheeses- along with butter and sweet cream. Separation technology- which allowed cream cheese to stay fresher much longer – going from 18 days to 120 days- was developed in Beaver Dam by Oscar J. Link in the 1940’s. In the 1960’s the plant underwent a major remodeling to add additional cooler storage and dry storage. Kraft Heinz continues to invest in the Beaver Dam facility with state-of-the-art technologies in the cream cheese industry. jobDescription: General information All posting locations Jacksonville, Florida, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 22-Nov-2022 Ref # R-63366 Description & Requirements The Maxwell House International Coffee (MHIC) Technician operates and assists in repairs of equipment. Responsibilities include tasks associate with the Packing Area- Processing Area- Receiving and Shipping Area. Must be able to drive a forklift- and be able to utilize the computer for basic computing functions. Equipment owner and responsible for the sanitation of general work areas. Accountable for maintaining standard weights and meeting overall product quality standards. Knows and follows all facility safety requirements. Be able to function in an environment that requires constant change and continuous learning. MHIC Tech 1 will utilize the Kraft Heinz Management System (KHMS) concept which includes daily cleaning- inspection- lubrication- and re-tightening of critical components of machinery- overall sanitation of line on scheduled frequencies. Active team member of the work cell to improve OEE value and daily efficiencies through reducing equipment stops- identifying sources of contamination (SOC)- defects and line losses and working to eliminate each of those losses and upgrades to standard work methods. Responsibilities include Quality Maintain all 5S programs in work area. Perform daily TPM activities Cleaning- inspection- lubrication- and re-tightening of critical components on equipment. Clean entire line on scheduled intervals. Use of Quality Suites to enter all quality checks as required and directed. Check for hold restrictions prior to dumping raw materials (scan before dumping). Sample raw materials for quality analysis- and ship the sample to Corporate Quality. Collect and ship flavors standard samples as necessary. Report any “out of spec” product. Inspect equipment/procedures for defects and report defects to the proper people. Comply with all procedures and specifications to ensure product safety and integrity. Comply with all QCMS (Quality Chain Management System) procedures. Maintain GMPs and PPE standards. Place raw and packing material on hold and release when authorized. Maintain an understanding of departmental regulatory requirements. Cost Gain knowledge and support the KHMS process to identify losses and make improvements to the line to improve “stops” and efficiencies. Identify equipment SOC’s and work to eliminate losses. Suggest improvements to help reduce costs and improve procedures. Comply with all procedures to help reduce cost and eliminate wastes. Complete Kaizen events as assigned as a team member. Complete Root Cause Failure Analysis’s (RCFA’s) when needed. Develop knowledge and understanding of key measurements and cost drivers. Make go/no go decisions for ensuring people safety and product safety and quality. Delivery Maintain green room KPI boards- daily activity board and Loss boards. Have knowledge and understanding of the production process and production schedules Execute pits stops as scheduled. General information All posting locations Springfield, Missouri, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 18-Nov-2022 Ref # R-63523 Kraft Heinz Company Description & Requirements Springfield- MO The Kraft Heinz Company is currently seeking a Palletizer Technician to work at our facility in Springfield- MO. Ideal candidates must be motivated to work in a team-orientated- fast-paced environment. This position requires individuals to perform duties in a food manufacturing environment following strict quality and safety standards. Job Description The Palletizer Line Technician is primarily responsible for the overall operation- performance and maintenance of the lines. Responsibilities include covering Palletizers and related equipment in all areas of the plant. The Technician is responsible for the operation and coordination of affected associates in such areas as changeovers- start-up- continuous operations- sanitation- and shutdown of the process. The Technician is responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting all equipment associated with the area to prevent and/or correct all mechanical and minor electrical breakdowns. The Technician should facilitate use of the ‘team approach’ to seek continuous improvement and implement ideas. Technical Skills Develop and demonstrate the skills necessary to handle all mechanical related duties Operate- troubleshoot and repair all equipment (and related equipment) on the line to maximize efficiency Manage all documentation associated with the line- including but not limited to All QCMS documentation- Maintenance Logs- Downtime Trackers- Bill of Materials- Production OEE- etc. Schedule- perform and document Preventative Maintenance on assigned equipment Assist in creating PMs on equipment to manage breakdowns and reliability Communicate effectively with other Technicians to ensure coordination of maintenance efforts Assist plant electricians/PETs- as necessary- in troubleshooting electrical malfunctions of assigned equipment Manage all inventories and supplies associated with assigned area Ensure completion of all necessary package integrity checks (weights- seals- code dates- package material- etc.) Develop and demonstrate the skills necessary to perform all MQFS Testing duties Utilization of SAP System for production and maintenance needs Relieve other positions & shifts as needed (includes break-relief for other Palletizer Technicians) Perform sanitation and period cleaning duties Understand and efficiently utilize 5S process and lean principles Understand and accountable for the KHMS (Kraft Heinz Management System) practices such as 5S- involvement in process improvements- etc. Leadership Utilize Kaizen process for identifying improvement opportunities or items needing attention Promote and Support a Team Atmosphere amongst co-workers & departments; maintain a positive working relationship with all associates- across all shifts Ability to make proper decisions quickly- following standard operating procedures Ensure proper GMPs and good housekeeping practices are maintained Lead the training for Line Technicians- support maintenance and relief associates in problem-solving- troubleshooting and operations of mechanical and electrical equipment. Support all R&D trials along with assisting R&D associates with all aspects of a trail Active membership on sub-teams that may be required for CI within the facility Productivity Effective utilization of labor hours associated with running the business and developing an understanding of labor standards Supportive of department goals through O.C.I. Being innovative and establishing visionary goals and strategies for his/her process. Understand who your customers (Internal & External) are and the impact of all actions as related to the business Knowledge and understanding of quality standards; ensure that standards are followed & supported Attributes Willing to learn and accept the challenges of the position. Being receptive to constructive feedback. Have the perseverance to work through each issue until it is resolved Attendance- Job Performance and Work Rule violations will be reviewed for consideration of this position. Associate cannot be on written or final written warnings. Able to accept the responsibility of the line completely and make good decisions that affect the line and department General Minimum Requirements Line Technician must be responsible- mature- tolerant and professional in temperament Above standard oral and written communication skills are a must for this position Intermediate computer skills Line Technician must be focused on Safety and follow all safety rules Must be self-managing & motivated Must be willing to invest in self through training and education Supportive of plant and department goals and vision Positive work ethic- outlook and attitude Knowledgeable of and follows all Plant GMPs Willingness to work additional hours to cover break relief- vacations- call-ins- absences- etc. Including same shifts- opposite shifts- other shifts and/or days off. Able to work daily and weekly overtime and weekends as required All other duties assigned by leadership team. Knowledge Basic math- read/write and professional communication skills. Working Environment Primarily indoor where all work areas are at ambient temperatures; extreme cold to hot depending on the seasons. Potential exposure to product related dust/powder in the work areas. Operations are with allergen related ingredients. Qualifications Able to acquire PIV licenses. 3-Wheel- 4-Wheel- Hand Jack- Walkie Rider; along with additional equipment acquired at our facility meant for Palletizer Distribution use. Able to acquire all Maintenance related trainings & certifications along with the ability to certify on job Must be able to accurately perform systems such as; SAP- Matrics- MS Office Programs- Outlook- Vision Pro; along with additional systems which may be acquired for our facility. Able to receive trainings and operate equipment efficiently Physical Requirements Performs bending- squatting- kneeling- sorting- ascending- descending and reaching to both ground level along with overhead. Must be capable of moving up to 50 pounds and/or +50 pounds with help. Holds and grips object; must possess manual dexterity necessary to operate equipment and disassemble and reassemble equipment EEO Policy Kraft Heinz is an EO employer – Minorities/Women/Vets/Disabled and other protected categories Benefits & Compensation Overview We offer a variety of benefits including $1-500 sign-on and retention bonus $500 sign-on bonus after successful completion of 30 days. $1-000 retention bonus after successful completion of 6 months of active employment. 4 Medical Plan options 3 Dental Plan options Vision Plan option 401k with matching contributions Additional perks Company Paid Life Insurance Policy- Paid Parental Leave- Short-Term & Long-Term Disability plans- Wellbeing Program- Employee Assistance Program- Pet Insurance- plus other additional benefits. Vacation starting from date of hire $29.39 per hour- plus shift differential for second and third shifts FOIP (Field Operations Incentive Plan) – Bonus Plan Work Schedule We are a 24/7 facility offering both 8-hour and 10-hour shifts as well as 12-hour rotating shifts. Work schedule is dependent on position. Plant & Community Overview Plant Overview Over 1-000 employees make up the team at the Springfield facility. A variety of cheese products (Sliced/Chunk/Shred)- and pasta Mac & Cheese meals are produced at this location. Community Overview Welcome to the birthplace of Route 66! Springfield- MO combines a small-town vibe with the energy of a college town and amenities of a big city. With an attractive cost of living and strong local economy- Springfield is well-positioned to continue its reliable growth. Residents enjoy four distinct seasons and a wealth of outdoor recreational opportunities including cycling- fishing- and hiking. The city is also host to the Springfield Cardinals- the Double-A affiliate of the St. Louis Car

Kraft purchased the Phenix Cheese Company in 1928- only 25 years after selling cheese to grocers in Chicago from his horse drawn wagon. PURPOSE – This job performs the tasks of packaging finished products into containers. Primary duties include packing product from machines into boxes- inspecting products- documenting weights- palletizing boxes- and assisting Machine Operators. Correctly fill out paperwork (Downtime Sheets- HOTS Report- etc). Principal Accountabilities – Makes up corrugated boxes. Place finished merchandise in boxes. Seals cases with tape gun or tape machine. Labels finished cases with proper identification. Places finished cases on pallets using pre-determined case placements. Monitors machinery for film splices- breakage- and machinery jams and reports them to the Machine Operator immediately. Assists Machine Operator as necessary. Places stickers or other identifying information as requested by a particular customer. Replaces tape in machine. Recognizes quality issues- such as weak seals and eye out registration. Monitors one machine while operator is repairing or setting the other machine up. Monitors merchandise cases to insure proper weight and accurate packaging components. Places damaged product packages into proper containers. Participate in 5S processes - embrace and support Continuous Improvement. Operate equipment in a safe manner following Safety Standards- GMP guidelines- and sustaining 5s. Maintain Oscar boards and MUDA waste. Participate and collaborates in meetings. Train others and fills in for other positions as necessary. Fills in for other positions as necessary. Supports the Jacksonville plant FSQ and QRMP initiatives on any and all procedures/programs pertaining to product safety. Other duties as assigned Additional responsibilities of this position include assisting in the creation of a culture of safety and health by performing work safely in accordance with all company safety procedures. Operates equipment safely and reports any unsafe work conditions or practice to supervisor. Occupational safety and health performance is measured in this position Knowledge/Experience/Competencies- Excellent analytical- reasoning- math- and organizational Skills. Minimum of 6 months previous experience in food/beverage manufacturing is desired. Must have a solid understanding of process improvement methods. Computer skills desired. General information All posting locations Champaign, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 31-Oct-2022 Ref # R-62697 Description & Requirements Key Responsibilities of the Role To ensure projects are completed on time within budget or with successful attainment of objectives. Completes specific phases or aspects of the project such as technical studies- product design- preparation of specifications and technical plans and product testing. Coordinates activities concerned with technical developments- scheduling- and resolving engineering design and test problems. Controls expenditures within limitations of project budget. Prepares interim and completion project reports. Provide functional and technical support to the factories to minimize production and maintenance problems. Apply engineering expertise to equipment design- problems solving- and quality improvement. Participate in committee or task forces where necessary to contribute to company goals. Support PRC and key support projects as technical advisor or project manager. In every activity- use the principles of TQM “To do the job right the first time”. This includes establishing requirements and the process maps necessary to meet the customer’s requirements and all things done right the first time. Promote TQM through actions and communications to all customers (internal and external)- conformance to requirements- to provide quality products and services and provide technical solutions/leadership for the reduction in cost of quality. Development of project scope- justification- and factory/company impact. Appropriation preparation including cost estimates- savings- and timing plan. Development and management of cost controls- asset controls and scheduling controls. Hires and supervises various contractors in the scope of project manager. This may encompass all project areas and total up to 50 people dispersed among distinct trades. General information All posting locations Jacksonville, Florida, United States of America Job Function 07 - Quality Date Published 07-Oct-2022 Ref # R-61801 Description & Requirements This role is responsible for monitoring and maintaining the plants Quality systems to ensure compliance to regulatory- federal and local laws. Areas of focus will include the identification and achievement of facility Quality KPI's through appropriate corrective/preventive actions and continuous improvement initiatives. This role will actively participate in all internal and external auditing activities and follow-up. Further- this role will act as support for QCMS/ISO; QRMP and HACCP functions will lead the development of new quality systems/programs across the facility and will provide Quality support/resources for major commercialization projects. Key Components of the role Actively engaged support in planning- defining and directing the site auditing control program to ensure compliance to all procedures- and policies- GMP standards- Kraft Heinz requirements- and regulatory- federal and local laws. Support the QRMP system and operational standards as outlined in the plant accountability list. Trains- mentors and leads site QA and Production team to insure program goals are met. Strong support to site QCMS/ISO Coordinator. Monitors and maintains plant QCMS/QRMP program by complying to current Kraft Heinz and International Audit (FSSC/ISO) standards. Facilitate and co-lead site cross functional QCMS/QRMP Team and participate with Kraft corporate to insure successful certification for site. Ensure all Specification/KPI/QCMS/QRMP/FSSC/ISO/ plans are maintained and Support all internal and external inspections/regulatory visits. Support audit preparation activities- accompany inspector- and complete necessary reports and postings. Perform follow-ups to non-conformances found and provide responses as appropriate. Review and approve minor change requests. Responsible for Hold/Release documentation and dispositioning of products. Execute validation studies for all CCPs- OPRPs and other significant controls in accordance with approved methodologies. Ensures compliance to Golden Rules and other Quality principles through routine auditing- reporting- and trending compliance appropriately. Provides expertise and actively participates in equipment commissioning and startup- ensuring standardization of all applicable quality and food safety procedures. Adhere to approved change control procedures- to include reviewing partial HACCP plans and issuing Agile change requests- as needed. Qualifications Proven history of technical quality or production knowledge of policies & programs in Food or relevant manufacturing settings. Education or Operational/On the job knowledge of Food Science- Food Production- Manufacturing Quality/Operations- or other relevant environments. Strong leadership- technical- communication and organizational skills required along with attention to detail. Knowledge of quality or production systems- procedures- & policies. Handle multiple assignments- develop work plans- & prioritize. Knowledge of statistical processes. Planning and organizing skills. Successful candidates possess a positive focus toward solutions with emphasis on preventative pro-active measures and team-building. Must be able to work shifts- weekends- and all required overtime. Prompt and regular attendance. Today, The Kraft Heinz Company is building a new legacy by investing in a robust Digital infrastructure to revolutionize the food and beverage industry. We are on a journey to create a digitally-powered, agile-enterprise – all while honoring a 150-year heritage and a portfolio of 200 iconic brands. At the heart of this journey is our ambition to create an environment where powerful AI solutions augment humans and where small mission-based teams relentlessly pursue tangible solutions for our consumers, customers, and the enterprise. What You’ll Do A Scrum Master at Kraft Heinz helps support the development team and product owner in delivering incremental value each sprint for the products. They are knowledgeable in scrum and are able to educate others on Agile methodologies and practices. They remove impediments and act as a shield from external distractions. They create a safe working environment for the team and are an innovator who constantly seeks continuous improvement and builds higher performing teams. Build and coach high performing teams. Lead and manage all scrum related activities for your pods. Facilitate the daily standup meetings which includes both verbal and email communications to collect and consolidate team updates. Work across sprints to help facilitate capacity conversations and identify work that may be blocked due staffing/casting challenges. Help organize, prep, and facilitate planning sessions & estimations for future sprints. Mentor and develop new Associate Scrum Practitioners added to the group. Look at key metrics such as sprint velocity, scope, flow and improve the overall pod performance Flag issues/risks and other key actions that may need to interface with non-agile portions of the company Manage and activate release plans Ability to work with relevant engineering teams to ensure DevOps related activities occur as intended Ensure teams actions are aligned with the project goals / vision. Ensure Scrum practices are used and improved within and across teams Identify trade-offs between short- and long-term benefits to drive shared vision between the team and product owner. Foster a continuous learning environment helping teams to inspect & adapt Facilitate large group discussions Who You Are Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent; Masters preferred 1-3 years of relevant work experience with Agile and Scrum Certified Scrum Practitioner (CSP) or Certified Scrum Coach (CSC) (not required) Knowledge of relevant domains/products/journeys and track record in successful delivery SAFe 5.0 Certifications are a plus Design Thinking Certifications are a plus Ability to promote innovative thinking and self-improvement within the team Confident and skilled at guiding the team through organizational road-blocks to allow Sprints to be completed on time Past software development experience would be ideal Experience with Jira/Confluence is a must, Azure DevOps is optional, Miro or other similar whiteboarding tool is an advantage. jobTitle: Senior Financial Analyst- Internal Controls Business Process Auditor
jobDescription: General information All posting locations Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 03 - Finance Date Published 30-Nov-2022 Ref # R-62202 Position Summary Description & Requirements The Senior Financial Analyst - Internal Controls is responsible for providing leadership to drive an effective and efficient control environment supporting assigned business process areas. The position provides broad exposure to various levels of management and offers an excellent opportunity to gain an understanding of the Kraft Heinz control environment- business practices and systems. Activities will also include working with members of external audit. The Kraft Heinz Internal Control Department’s vision is to add value by providing objective and innovative assurance and advisory services. When performing our work- we evaluate risks- controls and governance processes. Further- we provide the board of directors- audit committee- and KH senior management reasonable assurance that the financial data used to make business decisions and to communicate to the public is true and accurate. We also identify business improvement opportunities (i.e. efficiency and effectiveness of operations) to make our business better. We accomplish our mission by recruiting and developing talent for the entire corporation- providing high-quality services to support the department’s vision. The qualified candidate must be able to work with multiple organizations and teams- consistently meet deadlines and work well under time constraints and be able to quickly learn and understands diverse business areas/systems. This position offers high career visibility with the potential to move into various roles within the Kraft Heinz Company. Primary Responsibilities Partner with the business to ensure an effective and efficient controls environment. Conduct business process reviews so as to evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls over the business cycles. Ensures an understanding of the control and the test for that control are formally documented in process narratives and testing template. Coordinate the execution of all Financial Controls testing with controls owners. Assist in facilitating Control Test & Review timelines for completion. Financial Controls continuous testing- deficiency and remediation monitoring and reporting for senior management. Ensures deficiencies are properly documented with action plans for remediation. Ensures action plans are implemented- and the controls are retested to demonstrate successful remediation within the specified time frames. Evaluate key systems and Third Party Reporting documentation over the adequacy/efficiency of accounting- financial and operating procedures. Implementation of continuous monitoring and automation of controls initiatives. Supporting various corporate or systems initiatives through a review of end-to-end process designs for areas of high risk and or materiality. Ensures all information and documentation is maintained in the system of record. Strong written- verbal communication skills and detail oriented in process documentation and testing. Support and coordinate with external auditors with their requests and any follow ups. Be an advocate for process change; identifying opportunities for best-practice improvement and work closely with teams to implement change. Assisting with other ancillary projects and analyses as assigned by Global Head of Internal Controls. jobDescription: General information All posting locations Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 03 - Finance Date Published 05-Oct-2022 Ref # R-61491 Position Overview Description & Requirements This role reports to the Sr. Manager- Manufacturing Financial Reporting and Analytics- and will support financial reporting and internal controls for manufacturing operations throughout the North America zone. jobDescription: General information All posting locations Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 03 - Finance Date Published 25-Oct-2022 Ref # R-62107 Position Summary Description & Requirements The Corporate Development (Corp Dev) team is a key part of Kraft Heinz’s agile portfolio management strategy and comprises a few high-performing teams that each focus on different parts of the deal lifecycle. The M&A Execution team works alongside the Corp Dev Deal team- M&A Legal team- and the Corp Dev Strategy team to execute projects that take Mergers- Acquisitions- Divestitures or Joint Ventures and make them a reality for Kraft Heinz. The work we do is intricate and complex; it calls for both big-picture thinking and hands-on problem-solving. This role is responsible for leading one or more projects owned by the M&A Execution team- often called the Integration / Separation office. Within these projects- members of the team will translate the vision and goals of the deal at hand into operational decisions and outcomes- establish project management structures- processes- and tools- and partner with cross-functional teams to drive these strategic initiatives to completion. Our ideal candidate will take the lead in distilling deal vision into well thought-out integration and separation plans and ensuring the highest project management standards are upheld throughout the execution of those plans. Effective resolution of issues and timely delivery of project deliverables is critical to success in this role. Additionally- in leading an integration or separation project- the candidate will serve as a key partner to the leaders of the project on either the buy or sell side of the transaction. This is a high-visibility- high-impact role with opportunities to engage with stakeholders of all levels throughout the organization. This position reports to the Head of M&A Execution. If you are excited to work on high-profile projects and make a real impact on the company’s bottom line- we’d love to talk to you! Primary Responsibilities Oversee the deal timeline and hold teams accountable for delivering milestones Partner closely with buyers / sellers to ensure agreements with the counterparties are upheld by the project team and Kraft Heinz at large Mobilize functional teams to develop and execute against workplans to realize deal value Identify and solve complex cross-functional challenges related to integration and separation Own program management tool suite (trackers- workplans- process flows- etc.) that facilitate the risks- issues and change control processes Develop materials for key forums and meetings by engaging with functional leads to ensure timely and accurate reporting of project progress Manage vendors and solution providers that we partner with on relevant projects Work with the team’s financial analyst to generate and obtain management approval for project budgets. This will require cross-functional collaboration to ensure understanding of the resource requirements (people- vendor- technology) across the different workstreams. Develop and document integration and divestiture practices and playbooks to support continuous growth Qualifications Bachelor Degree is required- MBA or Advanced Degree preferred Minimum 7 years of demonstrable Project Management and project discipline experience- including relevant methodologies and tools. jobDescription: General information All posting locations Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 11 - Logistics Date Published 14-Jun-2022 Ref # R-56423 Description & Requirements As a Sr. Analyst- Dedicated Fleet – Zone Technical Logistics- you will be expected to continue supporting and improving our dedicated carrier impact within transportation and logistics. You will be responsible for assisting in in-depth analyses of carrier networks and making recommendations to improve or grow fleet presence within the organization to improve both logistics cost and carrier service. You will be building relationships with our third-party dedicated fleet partners. You will also be responsible for determining and tracking individual key performance metrics related to their service and network optimization. This role provides a unique opportunity to utilize relationship-building and analytical skills to make impactful decisions in an ever-changing transportation market. Running Reports/Organizing Data/ Reporting Results Calculate breakevens and provide savings monthly for dedicated fleets. Update KHC productivity reporting tools monthly to ensure a seamless financial view. Prepare transportation KPI results for MPR reviews for Sr. Leadership. Collect and prepare data for annual dedicated fleet bids for rate negotiations Run Baseline Summary Report- clean and organize data into a format that can be used by the capacity planning and transportation teams Dedicated Fleet Optimization – Short Term (current week/month) Send out a list of overnight load time-outs to dedicated fleets to do pullbacks Actively participate in weekly KPI meetings with carriers to discuss cost and service. Build relationships with carrier partners to drive collaboration and performance. Assist Sr. Manager in developing actions for capacity planning rate reviews when lanes are favorable/unfavorable. Collaborate with Region Transportation Managers to understand drivers of performance and assist in building action plans to solve when performance is low or plan to replicate best practices when performance is high. Onboard new carriers and other users into the system Invoice Management/Accounting Process invoices in the KHC payment system for dedicated carrier invoices Owner of the month-end re-classes accounting process to ensure shipments planned outside of the TMS are properly accounted for the previous month. General information All posting locations Remote, Pennsylvania, United States of America Job Function 04 - IT Date Published 02-Dec-2022 Ref # R-61873 Description & Requirements If you are looking for a company where you constantly challenge yourself- where achievement and talent are what count- check out this position. It is both a strategic and a tactical position This role owns and is responsible for the day-to-day activities related to specifying- configuring- testing and deploying OMP finite scheduling to factories of the Kraft Heinz Company as part of the KHC North American program. This is a 3-year program that will replace SAP APO technologies with OM Partners OMP+ solution. This person will be a capable experienced IT project team member used to supporting finite scheduling. Day-to-day activities include working with KHC IT partners to determine the correct model to use for the factory- configuring the OMP/SAP tools- testing the solution from unit testing- through system integration testing to acceptance testing and training manufacturing users in both the KHC process and the OMP system to be used. This person will collaborate with IT- the Data Management Organization and KHC Operations in order to deliver their goals. Support OMP/SAP config of the facilities formalizing the modelling into the software tool. Record in standard documentation the OMP/SAP configuration performed. Perform go-live cutover tasks such as loading the new system with data extracted from the legacy system. jobDescription: General information All posting locations Glenview, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 07 - Quality Date Published 02-Dec-2022 Ref # R-63242 Description & Requirements This role supports the implementation and execution of key food safety factory programs within a specific business unit. Role includes reviewing product/process design with R&D to ensure food safety and designing challenge studies when & where required. The position provides HACCP plan development and validation support to internal/external plants. This position builds an awareness of regulatory requirements directly related to the product category supported so to advise category business partners. The person will work with a Business Unit on food safety related issues and partner with central Quality and R&D functions on development and implementation of policies & procedures. Key Components of the role This role provides scientific and technical food safety to the BU/Region to ensure product safety and quality by participating in evaluation of suppliers and co-manufacturers. Identify and communicate food safety risks to BU/Region- giving actionable advice on Food Safety programs (GMPs- verification testing- foreign material management- contaminants- allergen management- HACCP- etc.). Work with business partners where improvements and execution of relevant HACCP models- zoning and environmental monitoring are required at internal factories- pilot plant facilities- and suppliers/external manufacturers. Conduct validation of Critical Control Points related to lethal/kill steps (Cooking- formulation- etc.) for renovated products and/or processes- and assess validity of data obtained by others. Advise factories on implementation of thermal processing- formulation or related control steps to ensure critical limits are consistently met. Work with Product Development/R&D to ensure proper design of renovated products through food safety/quality controls and provide risk evaluation to the Business Unit. Work Cross-functionally with POD Quality- Supplier Quality- and Procurement to establish food safety specifications for ingredients and ensure compliance. Review application of challenge studies- shelf-life studies and process control validation studies to ensure critical limits for critical processes are appropriate for renovated products. Review validation data and approve microbiological test methods (rapid and cultural) for the Kraft Heinz Laboratory network. Remain current in scientific and regulatory principles of food safety to ensure most relevant information and emerging issues are identified and incorporated into Kraft Heinz food safety programs. Qualifications Master’s degree in Food Science- Microbiology- Food Engineering- or related field required. Ph.D. degree preferred. 3-5 years of experience of relevant food safety or food processing experience required. Prior HACCP certification preferred. Knowledge and implementation of HACCP and Food Safety practices- ideally across different product categories. Knowledge and in-depth understanding of various regulatory requirements (USDA- FDA- CFIA). Knowledge and in-depth understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices- Pathogen Environmental Monitoring- and Facility / Equipment Design. Experience with microbiology laboratory techniques and rapid test methods. Awareness and understanding of quality systems/processes (ISO- Six Sigma etc.) Excellent communication skills (presentation- report writing- teaching/training). Work experience in team-oriented functions as well as individual contribution. Action oriented with good project management skills. Travel requirements up to 30% a year. jobTitle: TGL Technical Group Leader Lunchables AVON $5000 Sign on Bonus
jobDescription: General information All posting locations Avon, New York, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 15-Nov-2022 Ref # R-63305 Job Description Description & Requirements INFORMATIONAL JOB POSTING Job Title Line Technician Department Lunchables Rate $31.60 Shift 1 Day shift (weekends) Thurs-Sun- 1 night shift (weekends) Fri-Mon Openings 2 Date Posted 8/18 Statement Summary/Job Description This role is responsible for overall line performance across Safety- Quality- Cost- Delivery and Morale. It will require leadership skills to drive team performance and maintenance skills to drive operational improvements. This position will focus on the successful operation of the production area to which they are assigned. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated individual- who will provide daily leadership to all aspects of a safe and efficient operation that produces quality product- right the first time. Reinforces Safety- Teamwork- and Continuous Improvement as a critical business philosophy and supports implementation of Oscar / Rail action plans for assigned line- equipment- and system design. Technical Knowledgeable and capable of performing sanitation- line setup- start-up- adjustment and operation of equipment- proper shutdown & changeover as required to Kraft Heinz standards and to minimize downtime Perform all required quality testing/checks and complete all required documentation for line operations Quality (Quality Suites)- Sanitation- Safety- etc. Responsible for troubleshooting and repair of all equipment- planned and unplanned Assist Maintenance Leads with basic electrical equipment troubleshooting and maintain/improve electrical control systems Utilize maintenance windows to coordinate routine and non-routine activities on assigned equipment in order to ensure safety- product quality and optimum line efficiency. Will work across shifts and functions as needed to effectively operate as a team Complete and document preventive maintenance inspections on assigned line as assigned by the Maintenance Lead. Recommend and implement continuous improvement on equipment/systems design Ability to lead and participate in Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) process to prevent reoccurring equipment failures. This will include driving completion of all agreed upon actions identified in RCFA. Utilize SAP and other systems to document maintenance activities- order parts when applicable- assist in the scheduling and development of work orders Recording and documentation as required by manual- computer and other systems. Ensures documentation is accurately completed using QCMS and QRMP guidelines Participate in the QRMP yearly audit and assist in the development of procedures and corrective actions Ensure compliance with Quality Platinum and Golden Rules Leadership Holds team accountable to high standards across Safety- Quality- Cost- Delivery and Moral Ensure the team is organized and focused on the right business priorities at all times and provide continuity between shifts. Kraft purchased the Phenix Cheese Company in 1928- only 25 years after selling cheese to grocers in Chicago from his horse drawn wagon. In 1929- approximately 90 employees in the Kraft-Phenix Cheese Plant in Beaver Dam produced 10 million pounds of Philadelphia Cream Cheese- Neufchatel- Camambert Cheeses- along with butter and sweet cream. Separation technology- which allowed cream cheese to stay fresher much longer – going from 18 days to 120 days- was developed in Beaver Dam by Oscar J. Link in the 1940’s. In the 1960’s the plant underwent a major remodeling to add additional cooler storage and dry storage. Kraft Heinz continues to invest in the Beaver Dam facility with state-of-the-art technologies in the cream cheese industry. General information All posting locations Dover, Delaware, United States of America Job Function 06 - Manufacturing Date Published 28-Oct-2022 Ref # R-62624 Description & Requirements Reports to a maintenance supervisor and working in a team environment- interacts with all hourly and salaried maintenance and production personnel. Observes and interprets readings on gauges- meters- and charts that record various aspects of the system's operations at specified intervals to verify operating conditions. Adjust controls to ensure safe and efficient operation of the system to meet the demands for the specified service. Perform inspections as necessary to verify that the designated facilities are functioning within condition limits for the purpose intended. Conduct water tests and make necessary adjustments to pumps- softeners- and controllers. Maintain a log in which various aspects of the system's operation are recorded- e.g.- run time- system pressure- filter differential pressure- temperature- equipment status- water levels- voltage load- analysis of flue gases and generator balance. Keep designated equipment and machinery in working order by performing such tasks as tightening fittings- repacking bearings- replacing packing glands- gaskets- valves- recorders and gauges- and cleaning and replacing burners or other components- using hand tools and power tools. Operate computer control system to accomplish specific tasks relating to building and equipment operation. Operates the plant boilers and water softeners- air compressors- ammonia chillers- cooling towers- wastewater facilities and other utility systems in a safe manner. Monitor and maintain correct boiler chemistry. Maintains plant and pump station building and grounds. Assist with and provide support for the maintenance of the plant including installation- repairing- maintaining- set up- troubleshooting- and / or operating Plant Utility systems mentioned above. Maintain cleanliness of all areas of responsibility and proper care for tools. Lubricates motors and gearboxes as needed and when indicated by UE ultrasonic equipment. Other duties include proper use and care for tools- maintaining daily operations and maintenance logs. Accountable for the QRMP (Quality Risk Management Process) standards as outlined in the plant’s QRMP accountability document- including the implementation- improvement and ongoing maintenance Actively participate in an aggressive self-development training program that will be designed to dramatically increase one’s technical proficiencies.
